metadata.title: CVE-2023-32254 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's ksmbd, a high-performance in-kernelSMB server. The specific flaw exists within the processing ofSMB2_TREE_DISCONNECT commands. The issue results from the lack of properlocking when performing operations on an object. An attacker can leveragethis vulnerability to execute code in the context of the kernel.
